Associated Luxury Hotels Vastly Expands With Addition of 76 Hotels Outside of North America
Associated Luxury Hotels International has expanded its worldwide portfolio with the addition of 76 magnificent Four- and Five-Diamond quality-level hotels and resorts located outside of North America. The hotels and resorts, all owned and/or operated by highly-respected Kempinski Hotels, are situated in 31 countries outside of the U.S., with 17 hotels in Western Europe, 13 hotels in Eastern Europe, 26 hotels in Asia, 10 hotels in Africa, and 10 hotels in the Middle East.
The strategic addition to the ALHI Global Sales Organization (GSO) helps address the growing demand for international Meeting & Incentive (M&I) programs, as these hotels and resorts are now represented by ALHI (alhi.com) to North American meeting professionals, incentive specialists and business executives interested in conducting meetings and/or incentive programs. The addition of these properties brings ALHI’s portfolio to over 250 luxury-level (Four- and Five-Diamond quality) hotels and resorts around the world, which all specifically serve the Meetings & Incentive marketplace. ALHI’s portfolio now features more than 100 international options in 44 countries, some of the world’s best Destination Management Companies (DMCs) in 65 countries, plus a variety of 23 luxury-level cruise ships (Norwegian Cruise Line, Regent Seven Seas Cruises and Oceania Cruises), to complement its extraordinary portfolio in the U.S., in order to best serve its Accounts with an impressive variety of solutions around the world. The announcement was made jointly by ALHI CEO David Gabri and ALHI President Jim Schultenover.
Founded in 1897 in Berlin, Germany, Kempinski Hotels is Europe’s oldest luxury hotel group, and one of the most respected hotel companies in the world. Now headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, Kempinski is known for its luxurious and distinctive hotels and resorts, impeccable personal service, fascinating destinations, superb hospitality, attention-to-detail, consistency, and reliability. The portfolio comprises historic grand landmark hotels, superb city hotels, award-winning lifestyle hotels, and exquisite resorts. Each property imbues the high quality that groups and guests have come to expect from Kempinski, while embracing the cultural traditions of its location.
Examples of the special charm of each hotel reflecting its cultural environment include the Hotel Adlon Kempinski opposite the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin, the majestic Emirates Palace in Abu Dhabi, the Ciragan Palace Kempinski in Istanbul , and the Siam Kempinski Hotel Bangkok.
